Sentencas: This work describes manufacture, analysis and test of a new well conducting corrosion-protection coating that can be applied on steel types with high chromium content.
Titulo: Effective yttrium based coating for steel interconnects of solid oxide cells: Corrosion evaluation in steam-hydrogen atmosphere

Sentencas: Electrolytic deposition of yttrium salts is used to form thin (<100 nm) coatings on both flat steel sheets (material: Crofer 22 APU) and its properties are proven on woven wire-meshes (materials from two different sources: SUS316 and SUS316L).
Titulo: Effective yttrium based coating for steel interconnects of solid oxide cells: Corrosion evaluation in steam-hydrogen atmosphere

Sentencas: The oxide scale on the coated Crofer 22 APU sheet remains intact after 2000 h operation at 750 degrees C in H-2 with 90% H2O.
Titulo: Effective yttrium based coating for steel interconnects of solid oxide cells: Corrosion evaluation in steam-hydrogen atmosphere

Sentencas: The corrosion rate at 750 degrees C of the coated Crofer 22 APU sheets is compared with that of uncoated samples and of samples with a commercial magneton sputtered CGO coating revealing that the coatings reduce the parabolic rate constant characteristic of the corrosion by a factor of 10 and 20 for the CGO and the Y, respectively.
Titulo: Effective yttrium based coating for steel interconnects of solid oxide cells: Corrosion evaluation in steam-hydrogen atmosphere

Sentencas: The coated meshes also exhibit high corrosion resistance and long-term-stable low electrical resistance at 650 degrees C, both in 90% H2O in H-2, and in air.
Titulo: Effective yttrium based coating for steel interconnects of solid oxide cells: Corrosion evaluation in steam-hydrogen atmosphere

Sentencas: In addition to the experimental work, Y-Cr-O-2 phase diagrams are constructed illustrating the high stability of the YCrO3 phase (that forms during corrosion) over a wide temperature and pO(2) range.
Titulo: Effective yttrium based coating for steel interconnects of solid oxide cells: Corrosion evaluation in steam-hydrogen atmosphere
